ASA’s Partnership Dialogue Series: A Focus on Communication
Dear {!Contact.FirstName},
It's not too late for you to RSVP to participate in ASA's Partnership Dialogue Series: A Focus on Communication.
As part of our Partnership Dialogue Series, we’re proud to host an exchange among our colleagues in Nashville, TN on March 13, 2008. In this upcoming series, we will explore the challenges of effectively communicating with students and families today. With the overwhelming array of media available, ranging from podcasts to phone calls and text messages, which methods do you feel comfortable using? And which methods are the most effective for your Millennial students and Baby Boomer parents? Be educated, ask questions, and receive feedback from colleagues, lenders and American Student Assistance on one of the hottest topics affecting financial aid offices across the country.
Date: March 13, 2008 8:00 – 9:00 a.m. Continental Breakfast 9:00 a.m. –12:00 p.m. Discussion and Exchange of Ideas 12:00 – 1:00 p.m. Lunch
Location: Embassy Suites Nashville South Cool Springs
820 Crescent Centre Drive Franklin, TN 37067 http://www.embassysuitesnashvillesouth.com
For registration and additional information, including driving directions, please visit www.amsa.com/fap/training, e-mail your name, phone number and enrollment details to training@amsa.com, or call the Training Department at 800.999.9080, ext. 3099. I hope you can join us, and look forward to seeing you there.
Thank you, American Student Assistance
